bibl.title: Cleopatra's Snake or Octavian's? The Role of the Cobra in the Triumph over the Egyptian Queen. Avec résumé en anglais.
bibl.note: Cleopatra's asp in Rome. - The snake and military struggle. - The double snakes of Cleopatra. - Cleopatra's snake or Octavian's? - The authenticity of Cleopatra's snakes. - "In summary, Cleopatra probably did not commit suicide with the assistance of a snake or snakes. The originator of the tale about the royal asp's being the cause of her death may have been Augustus himself or someone close to him. It is not known what happened in reality."
bibl.seg: Kostuch Lucyna, Cleopatra's Snake or Octavian's? The Role of the Cobra in the Triumph over the Egyptian Queen. Avec résumé en anglais.

Cleopatra's asp in Rome. - The snake and military struggle. - The double snakes of Cleopatra. - Cleopatra's snake or Octavian's? - The authenticity of Cleopatra's snakes. - "In summary, Cleopatra probably did not commit suicide with the assistance of a snake or snakes. The originator of the tale about the royal asp's being the cause of her death may have been Augustus himself or someone close to him. It is not known what happened in reality."
